title: Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area
text:
Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area, is located near <a href="Pax%2C%20West%20Virginia">Pax, West Virginia</a> in <a href="Fayette%20County%2C%20West%20Virginia">Fayette</a> county. Located on land that varies from wetlands to steeply forested woodlands, the Pleasant Creek WMA rises to an elevation of .
Access to Plum Orchard Lake WMA is from the Mossy or <a href="Pax%2C%20West%20Virginia">Pax</a> exits of <a href="I-77">I-77</a>, then following County Route 23 (Paint Creek Road) to County Route 23/1 (Plum Orchard Lake Road.)
Hunting and Fishing.
Hunting opportunities in Plum Orchard Lake WMA include <a href="White%20tailed%20deer">deer</a>, <a href="raccoon">raccoon</a>, <a href="squirrel">squirrel</a>, <a href="Wild%20turkey">turkey</a> and <a href="waterfowl">waterfowl</a>.
Fishing opportunities in Plum Orchard Lake include <a href="largemouth%20bass">largemouth bass</a>, <a href="channel%20catfish">channel catfish</a>, <a href="crappie">crappie</a>, <a href="bluegill">bluegill</a>, <a href="Lepomis">sunfish</a>, <a href="crappie">crappie</a>.
Four boat ramps are available at Plum Orchard Lake. Forty-two (42) rustic camping sites for tents or trailers are available in the WMA.
